benchmark_details.name: SimSUM (Simulated Benchmark with Structured and Unstructured Medical Records)
benchmark_details.overview: SimSUM is a benchmark dataset of 10,000 simulated patient records that link unstructured clinical notes with structured background variables. It supports research on clinical information extraction in the presence of tabular background variables.
benchmark_details.data_type: simulated patient records (text and tabular data)

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To support research on clinical information extraction, enabling incorporation of structured features into the extraction of clinical concepts from unstructured text.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SimSUM is synthetic and does not capture the full complexity or variability of real electronic health records, and should not be used to evaluate clinical model performance.

data.source: Simulated data generated via a Bayesian network and a large language model (GPT-4o).
data.annotation: Automatically annotated with span-level symptom mentions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated as described in the baseline evaluation section.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate successful integration of structured and unstructured data for clinical information extraction.
methodology.baseline_results: The performance of baseline models using SimSUM showed improved accuracy in symptom extraction.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through expert evaluations and model performance analysis.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Not applicable as the dataset is synthetic.
